data.desc: Series 29 Hydrant - Squat Hydrant suitable for use with water and neutral liquids, to a maximum temperature of 70 degrees centigrade. Complies with requirements of BS750:2006 and BSEN1074-2:2004 and EN14339:2005, underground hydrants. Also to BS EN 1074-6 for potable (drinki …
data.weightSource: CoClear estimate based on product description
data.footprintChangeCategory: Model/parameters AND product carbon efficiency changed
data.footprintChangeReason: Previously AVK brought in the bodies and machined them in house. This arrangement has now changed and the bodies are brought in ready machined. The effect of this is a large rise in the emissions from supplier components. In addition the amount of CO2e emissions per valve has increased because the amount of emissions allocated to each valve is by weight of the product. The total number of products has decreased, therefore more emissions have been allocated to each product at the "Manufacture of AVK finished components" stage of the lifecycle. A slight increase in emissions is observed at the "Assembly and finishing of product" stage of the lifecycle. This is the result of a change in methodology to allocate the Scope 1 and 2 by weight of component compared to the total weight of all components and a decrease in the total weight of products sold in the reporting year.

data.name: Series 202/31 Repair Clamp
data.desc: The series 202/31 Supacollar is a multiple band repair clamp, for all ferrous pipes, PVC and AC.
data.weightSource: CoClear estimate based on product description
data.footprintChangeReason: This item was not included in last years report, but the emissions associated with this product have decreased from what they were during the last reporting period due to carbon reduction initiatives that took place. AVK UK's technical department re-designed a widely used component (ductile iron lug) to reduce the weight by 0.289kg (per lug).  This product contains 4 ductile iron lugs, and therefore the emission reduction is 4 x 0.289 x 1.4 = 1.62kg (9.71 tonne reduction over the reporting period from this product alone).

data.footprintChangeReason: Changes made to the B-Unit since the 2011 LCA that have affected emissions include: - Utilizing less, and less environmentally-impactful,  raw materials, lowering emissions in the "Raw Material" and "Assembly" phases. - The "Refurbishment" segment now requires no component replacement, lowering emissions. - Created new packaging for the B-Unit that included a small plastic component, which increased emissions in "Packaging" and "Distribution". - Eliminated emissions from the "Customer Use" Phase.

data.footprintChangeReason: The 2011 flat panel LCA was performed on a non-Energy Star 19" flat panel.  Since then, Bloomberg moved to an Energy Star 19" panel, and then for 2014 to an even more efficient 23" panel, meaning that most of the reduction comes from the "Customer Usage" phase of the life cycle.  Additionally, the "Raw Material" phase reduced emissions due to lighter LCD screens and cables, and a change in process has almost eliminated emissions from the "Assembly" phase.

data.name: Mobile Batteries

data.footprintChangeReason: According to newly installed assembly lines in Nanjing plant in 2013, the GHG emissions rose due to the increased electricity consumptions. The trend on rising electricity consumption level has close connection to the increased GHG emissions per the unit. The ratio of sales to Acer during 2013 shows a small difference relative to the one in 2012, so we estimate that the change in this row may not take place for the revenue fluctuation.  On the other hand, in 2013, Ochang 1 plant in Korea begun to supply mobile batteries to Acer for the first time - Only Nanjing plant supplied batteries to Acer in 2012. Therefore, the energy efficiency difference between the two plants would affect the change.

data.name: Quaker Oats 1Kg box sold in the United Kingdom
data.desc: Life Cycle Carbon Footprint for PepsiCo’s Quaker Oats 1Kg box sold in the United Kingdom.
data.weightSource: Specified by company
data.dataCorrections: Streamlined product name to be same across years
data.footprintChangeReason: Please note that 0.07 kg of CO2e reflects a per serving size of 40g. Reduced cooking times prescribed on pack. • Logistics efficiency improvements, notably: reduction of fuel consumption per km travelled (through vehicle replacements and driver efficiency); increased efficiency in network management resulting in less empty return journey’s. This included working with customers; substituting road transportation with rail between Cupar and our Southern Regional Distribution Centre. • A change in carton supplier between 2008 and 2010. • Increased product output per Kg oats, due to improved site efficiency with raw materials. The UK business has made a commitment to reduce the agricultural footprint (carbon & water) of key oat suppliers by 50% in 5 years.

data.footprintChangeReason: Please note that supplied figures are based on a re-baselined and certified Carbon Footprint with the Carbon Trust.  The date of previous figure supplied reflects the date of the previous certification.  The reduction in our Walkers Crisps product can be attributed to • Electricity and gas efficiency improvements at site as a result of continued reduction targets at site. • Reduction of fuel consumption per km travelled (through vehicle replacements and driver efficiency). • Increased efficiency in logistics network management, resulting in a reduction in less empty return journeys. This included partners with customers. • A secondary packaging (corrugate case) weight reduction of 5% • Increased efficiency of raw material use at sites.  The UK business has made a commitment to reduce the agricultural footprint (carbon & water) of key potato suppliers by 50% in 5 years – the results of this supply chain engagement should be evidenced in the next re-certification.

data.name: Walmart Brand Products
data.desc: Walmart Brand Product Emissions (Reported in kg CO2e/lb units)  12-Grain Bread, Honey Oatmeal Bread, Yeasty Dinner Rolls, Seeded Rye Bread, Pumpernickel Bread
data.weightSource: Specified by company
data.footprintChangeReason: We manufactured the same products for Walmart in FY15, so I would expect the emissions to be similar. Our production lbs of Walmart brand products increased 49.3% over FY15, but our emissions per unit stayed relatively constant (-2.07%). Due to mymanufacturing process it is difficult to obtain exact emission numbers for specific Walmart brand products. Thus, I calculate an emissions factor based on company-wide emissions, including all products produced, then multiply this emission factor by the weight of Walmart brand products. Due to this limitation in reporting, by Walmart brand emissions decreased because my emissions for all products decreased.

data.desc: SunPower® E-Series solar panels deliver efficient performance and long-lasting durability at a great value. Compared to other technologies, SunPower converts the greatest percentage of sunlight into electricity. This means that over the lifetime of your system, you’ll genera …
data.weightSource: CoClear estimate based on product description
data.footprintChangeReason: Higher efficiencies are produced by innovative cell designs and material and energy inventories that are different from those in the production of average crystalline silicon panels. In addition, higher efficiencies result to lower system environmental footprints as the system area on a kW basis is smaller. It was found that high efficiencies result to a net gain in environmental metrics (i.e., Energy Payback Times, GHG emissions) in comparison to average efficiency c-Si modules. The EPBT for the Sunpower modules produced in the Philippines and installed in average US or South European insolation is only 1.4 years, whereas the lowest EPBT from average efficiency c-Si systems is ~1.7 yrs. The SunPower modules produce 45% more electricity than average efficiency (i.e., 14%) c-Si PV modules.

copy.title: Global Publicly Disclosed Product Carbon Footprints
copy.header: CoClear brings you Carbon Catalogue, the first ever side-by-side carbon footprints of 866 products made by 145 companies in 28 countries. Select from one of your favorite companies, hover your mouse on a product, and explore the many ingenious ways to make better products with lower emissions.  Companies can make improvements anywhere along the value chain: Upstream, such as buying more sustainable raw materials, in their own manufacturing, or downstream, such as reducing a product's waste impact.
copy.footer1: About this visualization: CoClear specializes in low-cost, fast Life Cycle Analysis (LCA) to track efficiency opportunities across its clients' value chains. We developed this interactive visualization based on product LCA data that companies reported, for public disclosure, to the Supply Chain Questionnaire of CDP (formerly Carbon Disclosure Project). SpryGroup are software developers who created the online tool. © CoClear, 2019.
